question: Which of the following best explains why utility-based agents are considered more advanced than goal-based agents?
options: They avoid using internal models to save processing time.
They select any action that completes a goal, regardless of trade-offs.
They update their behavior over time using trial-and-error learning
They evaluate and rank multiple possible outcomes based on a utility function before selecting an action.
correct_answer: They evaluate and rank multiple possible outcomes based on a utility function before selecting an action.
explanation: Utility-based agents consider the desirability of different outcomes and choose actions that maximize overall utility, making them more sophisticated than goal-based agents.
